Pre-Game Insights: The pitch at Eden Gardens is not always easy to bat on, so 270-280 is likely to be a challenging score here.
If South Africa can bat first and score 10-20 runs above par, they will be firmly in the driver's seat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia and South Africa have faced off on 109 occasions in ODIs, with Australia winning 50 matches.
The start time for the match in India is 2:00pm IST.
Others: South Africa's chasing woes in this World Cup have been well-documented.
